intro: Cryptantha axillaris, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, ovate leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. Cryptantha axillaris is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
